title: 2025 Australian Open: A fan's guide to the season's first Grand Slam
description: Can Coco Gauff or Carlos Alcaraz win their first Australian Open title? Will Novak Djokovic extend his major record? All you need to know.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: 2025 Australian Open betting odds for women and men's tournaments
description: Aryna Sabalenka and Jannik Sinner are the betting favorites to win the 2025 women's and men's Australian Open.
author: ESPN

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Daniil Medvedev: Tactical genius & competitive fire
description: Daniil Medvedev is where tactical genius meets competitive fire. The 28-year-old has established himself as a consistent presence at the top of the ATP Tour. Known for his razor-sharp tactics and steely consistency, it all has added up to a memorable career, with plenty more to go.         View this post on Instagram                       A post shared by ATP Tour (@atptour) As a typically philosophical player, who never shies away from the truth, on or off the court, Medvedev has garnered the respect of his peers and fans alike. A master of adaptability, the 2020 Nitto ATP Finals champion has redefined what it means to stay at the top in today’s highly competitive field. Stay on their minds Medvedev is a mental puzzle that few players have managed to solve. With a style designed to disrupt rhythm and force opponents to second-guess their strategies, Medvedev is always a step ahead. Nowhere is this better exemplified than in his Lexus ATP Head2Head series with Alexander Zverev, in which Medvedev has won 11 of their previous 13 meetings. Stay consistent Consistency is the hallmark of greatness, and Medvedev’s record speaks for itself. A mainstay in the Top 10 of the PIF ATP Rankings since he first broke into in 2019, Medvedev has accumulated 20 tour-level titles in his career, including a US Open triumph in 2021. His ability to reproduce his best tennis year after year is underpinned by his relationship with the Nitto ATP Finals, the prestigious season finale that he has conquered once and made six consecutive appearances at. Stay the one to watch Medvedev’s unorthodox game style makes him one of the most unpredictable players in the sport. With his incredible rally tolerance and ability to turn defence into attack, one can never quite predict what he will do next. Whether it’s a daring passing shot from downtown or salvaging victory from the brink of defeat, Medvedev ensures he is always the player fans and opponents alike keep an eye on. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Shang Juncheng: The future is now
description: Shang Juncheng is no ordinary 19-year-old. The tremendous teen with a flashy lefty game is already making waves in the tennis world, firmly establishing himself as one of the ATP Tour’s most exciting prospects. As a beacon for the sport’s growth in China, and across the world, Shang is already setting an example even though his journey has just begun.          View this post on Instagram                       A post shared by ATP Tour (@atptour) Shang has displayed the grit and determination needed to break barriers and pave a new path that countless more will follow. Be the underdog Shang has had little trouble rising to the occasion throughout his fledgling career. Not only has he been forced to compete against the big names on Tour, but Shang has also carried the weight of expectations that comes with being a trailblazer for Chinese tennis. In October 2024, Shang became the first player born in 2005 or later to crack the Top 50 in the PIF ATP Rankings. Be China’s youngest champ The first taste of title success for Shang came on home soil in Chengdu, where he ousted top seed and World No. 19 Lorenzo Musetti in the final to become just the second Chinese player, and the youngest, to lift a trophy on the ATP Tour. By also becoming the first player born in 2005 or later to triumph, Shang further outlined his credentials as one of the Tour’s hottest emerging talents. Be a history maker The significance of Shang’s achievements — those he has achieved at an age when others are still finding their feet on the Tour — extends far beyond the court. In a country with a burgeoning tennis fanbase, his rise symbolises a breakthrough moment for Chinese tennis on a global stage. As he continues to climb towards the top of the sport, Shang is not just making history; he is inspiring the next generation to follow in his footsteps. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Fearnley handed Kyrgios blockbuster at Australian Open
description: Britain's Jacob Fearnley is set to face Nick Kyrgios - and a partisan home crowd - in the controversial Australian's return to Grand Slam tennis.

title: 'A unique opportunity' - Murray on phone call that led to Djokovic partnership
description: Andy Murray says he could not turn down the "unique opportunity" to coach his long-time rival Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open.

title: Australian Open Draw 2025
description: The 2025 Australian Open is upon us, and the draw took place on Thursday evening in Melbourne.  All the big names are present, with defending champion Jannik Sinner the top seed. While Zverev’s strong end to the season bumped him up to the second-seed position. Ten-time Australian Open champions Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz landed …
author: Jonathan

title: Sinner Cruises to ATP Finals Victory
description: Jannik Sinner is the 2024 Nitto ATP finals champion after comfortably defeating Taylor Fritz 6-4 6-4 in Sunday’s final, becoming the first player from his country to win the tournament in its 55-year history. The Italian emerges as the undefeated champion (without even dropping a set) and wins $4,881,100 in prize money, making it a …
author: Jonathan
